content.question: Part A The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 4 open parentheses 2 x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses e to the power of x close parentheses to the power of 5 over e to the power of 1 divided by 4 end exponent"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup><msup><mi>e</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mfrac></math>. (i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>. (ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals e to the power of 1 divided by 2 end exponent"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

frqParts.text: Part A The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 4 open parentheses 2 x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses e to the power of x close parentheses to the power of 5 over e to the power of 1 divided by 4 end exponent"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup><msup><mi>e</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mfrac></math>. (i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>. (ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals e to the power of 1 divided by 2 end exponent"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

Part B The functions <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses minus 5 log subscript 10 open parentheses 2 minus x close parentheses plus log subscript 10 3"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mn>3</mn></math> <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals sec x minus cos x"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sec</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>x</mi></math>. (i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single logarithm base <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses text expression end text close parentheses"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>. (ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a product involving <math alttext="tan x"><mi>tan</mi><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="sin x"><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></math> and no other trigonometric functions.

Part C The function <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="m open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 times inverse tangent open parentheses square root of 3 times pi x close parentheses"><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mi>Ï€</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find all values in the domain of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> that yield an output value of <math alttext="inverse sine open parentheses fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction close parentheses"><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
